thread.title: This matted ball of fur is actually a neglected dog
thread.title_full: This matted ball of fur is actually a neglected dog | Granada - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: This matted ball of fur is actually a neglected dog
text:
This matted ball of dirty hair that is in fact a severely neglected dog found wandering the streets.
Credit: MEN Syndication The pooch, who has been named Rosie, was handed into vets in Bury after she was found on Chesham Road, near Clarence Park, Bury, by a member of the public.
She was left in such an awful state that her flesh was covered in deep wounds and her skin was bleeding.
The shih tzu, thought to be aged between three and six-years-old, had no microchip or ID tag when she was handed in to vets on Tuesday afternoon, January 31. The vets immediately alerted the RSPCA.
RSPCA inspector Lorna Campbell, who is now investigating what happened to the poor dog, said:
Rosie has clearly been severely neglected and was in a terrible state when we got her.
You could barely tell she was a dog let alone what breed she was – she just looked like a dirty mop.
Her coat was a horrible brown/grey colour when it should have been a beautiful cream and she had huge matted knots and dreadlocks in her coat which had made her skin sore and bleeding.
The coat was so bad that the only option we had was to shave it all off. Once we’d removed the fur, it revealed a number of sores and wounds to her skin.
Vets believe her coat has been left to grow for a considerable length of time. Poor Rosie must have been so uncomfortable.
Bathing and grooming your pet dog is an important part of caring for them, just like walking them and taking them to the vets.
Rosie has not ended up like this overnight so must have been suffering for some time.
– RSPCA inspector Lorna Campbell Officers are now urging anyone who might recognise her or know where she has come from to get in touch with the RSPCA by calling their appeal line on 0300 123 8018. Animals Bury RSPCA
